title: Ways to Add CSS
subject: CSS
learning_objectives: Learn the three ways to insert CSS
Know when to use which method
theory:
There are three ways of inserting a style sheet:

1.  **External CSS**: The styles are defined in a separate `.css` file and linked in the HTML `<head>`. This is the best practice for professional websites.
2.  **Internal CSS**: The styles are defined within the `<style>` element, inside the `<head>` section of an HTML page. Good for single-page unique styles.
3.  **Inline CSS**: The styles are defined strictly within the `style` attribute of a specific HTML element. This is generally discouraged as it mixes content with presentation.

common_mistakes.correction: Avoid inline CSS. It makes maintenance difficult and overrides external styles.

interview_questions.question: Which CSS implementation method has the highest priority?
interview_questions.answer: Inline CSS has the highest priority among the three (excluding !important). It overrides Internal and External styles.

interview_questions.question: What is the benefit of External CSS?
interview_questions.answer: It allows you to change the look of an entire website by changing just one file. It also creates a clean separation of concerns.

practice_problems.problem: Write the HTML code to link a file named 'theme.css'.

real_world_use_cases.description: When a company changes its brand color, updating one Variable in an external CSS file updates thousands of pages instantly.

exam_notes: Inline styles behave like they have higher specificity than internal or external styles.
External styles are linked using the <link> tag.
Internal styles are written inside <style> tags.
summary: While there are three ways to add CSS, External CSS is the industry standard for scalable, maintainable web applications.
